name: incandescence
content:
incandescence noun [U]
(LIGHT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of producing a bright light from a heated part: Meteors and comets entering the earth's atmosphere compress the air and heat it to incandescence. The association seeks to reduce light pollution, the incandescence caused by outdoor night lighting.
literary the state of being extremely bright: Floodlighted, the white marble gleamed with a snowy incandescence. Glass cases of memorabilia glowed with an otherworldly incandescence.
More examplesFewer examplesThe animals hunt at night when steam plumes from power plants streak the sky with phosphorous incandescence. Quicklime burns with peculiar incandescence. Waves of incandescence sprayed across the night sky.

incandescence noun [U]
(QUALITY)
a very extreme emotion, especially anger or happiness: The interview revealed the incandescence of his anger over the war. His joyous incandescence brightened everyone around him.
the fact of being extremely good, special, or skilled: She lacks the starry incandescence other actors brought to the role. The box office is the ultimate measure of a superstar's incandescence. See
incandescent
